page.title: 02Local History
page.content: {Church of St Mary} The church is situated on the main Leominster to Brecon road.The church was built in the late 12th and early 13th century.It consists of a{Chancel} reconstructed in the 14th century,a Chancel arch rebuilt in the 15th century,a{Nave}built during the first half of the 12th century and a font whose base was built in the 14th century supporting a modern bowl.The south doorway and porch were built in the 14th century while the tower which consists of three storeys was built in the late 13th century.The bell tower houses four bells the fourth one probably dates back to the 14th century and on it is inscribed{"Jesu {salve me"}.The east window is a memorial to those who lost their lives in the 1914-18 war.
